      • detectNewParagraphs

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> detectNewParagraphs​(java.lang.String text)
        In a given String, this method looks out for a line separator (new Paragraphs), this can be different depending on the operating system. With the lineSeparator from the System-library, it can detect new Paragraphs no matter which operating system is used.
        Parameters:
        text - a given String to look out for new Paragraphs
        Returns:

      • formatParagraphWidth

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> formatParagraphWidth​(int width)
        With the "lineSeparator()", a new line can be detected on every System (e.g. in Windows it would be \r\n, in MacOS \n) This method returns a single paragraph with a line break (lineSeparator()) at the given width.
        Parameters:
        width - position at which a line break is added
        Returns:
        formatted list with the formatted paragraphs

      • get

        public java.lang.String get​(int index)
        Gets a chosen entry of the praragraphs list
        Returns:
        entry of the paragraphs list

      • getHelpMessage

        public java.lang.String getHelpMessage()
        Creates a help message to give the user some advice to use the application. Further information and a manual on how to use the application is on the Wiki-Page of the Github repository
        Returns:
        a short manual-text on how to use the editor

      • getWelcomeMessage

        public java.lang.String getWelcomeMessage()
        Creates a welcome message which is used from the method startApplication.
        Returns:
        the welcome message which is getting printed out to the user.
